alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 3:48AM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED TODAY... .Low pressure near the Mid Atlantic coastline this morning will rapidly intensify as it races northeast through the Gulf of Maine this afternoon. Heavy snowfall and snowfall rates of greater than 1 inch per hour are expected in the warning area. Rain changing to a wet snow will lead to slippery travel conditions in the advisory area. Some power outages can be expected. The precipitation will begin to diminish later this evening. However, strong northwesterly winds will continue overnight into Sunday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine. Portions of central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to low visibility and snow covered roads.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford
